questions.q: Thirty balls are numbered from 1 to 30. One ball is taken at random. What is the probability that the number on the ball will be an odd prime number?
What is the probability that a number selected at random from the set {2, 3, 7, 12, 15, 22, 72, 108} will be divisible by both 3 and 4?
A pyramids area in Giza has seven entrances. In How many ways a man can get in and out of that area without getting in and out from the same entrance.

A bag contains 8 red marbles, 3 yellow marbles, and 12 green marbles. How many addition red marbles must be added to the 23 marbles already in the bag so that the probability of randomly drawing a red marble is $\frac{2}{5}$?

Jerome, Kevin, and Seth shared a submarine sandwich. Jerome ate $\frac{1}{3}$ of the sandwich, Kevin $\frac{1}{6}$ of the sandwich, and Seth ate the rest. What is the ratio of Jerome's share to Kevin's share to Seth's share?
